text: we've come to a cave about ten
kilometers away from where the boys are
trapped and the conditions here are
really similar we're barely 20 meters
inside and already you get a real sense
of what it's like to be underground in
this part of northern Thailand the
passages the boys clambered through as
they tried to escape from the rising
water were much smaller than this one
we're still not far from the entrance
and it's humid it's dank you can hear
bats and it feels extremely
claustrophobic the water in these caves
is murky and muddy and just imagine if
this passage were flooded visibility
would be non-existent and obviously that
complicates any rescue attempt people
have to feel their way through the cave
now we're using lights at the moment
this is what it looks like without any
the caves here in Shanghai are beautiful
dramatic but as we've seen they can be
perilous - after an hour or so inside
you're pleased to be out here seeing
daylight once again those boys have been
trapped for nearly two weeks and this
whole country is hoping that they'll be
emerging extremely see
